headline: Big banks find many 'reasons to be optimistic about 2025' as Trump 2.0 nears
summary: Executives from the country’s biggest banks sounded optimistic Tuesday as they assessed the impact of a new Trump administration, the state of the US economy in 2025, and more interest rate cuts expected from the Federal Reserve.

headline: Gold Closes Back In On $2,700/oz
summary: Front-month gold futures settled up 1.2%, at $2,697.60 an ounce, its third consecutive gain and the highest close in over two weeks.

raw.headline: Gold Closes Back In On $2,700/oz

headline: Banking fees, MongoDB earnings, coffee prices: Market Minute
summary: Yahoo Finance host Rachelle Akuffo gives a quick breakdown of some of the day's top financial stories on this Market Minute. Citigroup (C) CFO Mark Mason expects up to a 30% rise in investment banking fees in the fourth quarter, which may indicate a rise in M&A activity. Shares of developer platform MongoDB (MDB) have fallen, despite beating third quarter earnings expectations. Finally, coffee futures (KC=F) hit a 47-year high, doubling year-over-year. Coffee producers are adjusting prices accordingly as South American weather conditions put a squeeze on Brazil's crop yield. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Kevin Hall

headline: Citi made 'significant progress' in transforming its business — and its CFO wants people to notice
summary: Citi’s (C) corporate overhaul began bearing fruit this year — and the bank is hoping it will catch continued windfalls in 2025 and beyond.

raw.headline: Citi made 'significant progress' in transforming its business — and its CFO wants people to notice
raw.summary: Citi’s (C) corporate overhaul began bearing fruit this year — and the bank is hoping it will catch continued windfalls in 2025 and beyond.

headline: Citigroup Is Analyst Mike Mayo’s Top 2025 Pick. ‘No Other Bank Comes Close.’
summary: Citigroup  is banking analyst Mike Mayo’s favorite choice for next year because he thinks the longtime laggard is making progress in its strategic transformation and is on track to hit key financial targets by 2026.  Citi shares, at around $72, are up 40% so far in 2024, better than Morgan Stanley and Bank of America, but behind  Goldman Sachs Group  and  JPMorgan Chase  Still, Citi shares are no higher than they were in late 2018.  Mayo says that Citi has undergone a strategic transformation over the past few years under CEO Jane Fraser as it focuses on five core business areas.
